questions.question: Person considered the father of the computer.
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage designed the first mechanical computer concept.

questions.question: The first electronic digital computer.
questions.explanation: ENIAC was completed in 1945 as the first general-purpose electronic computer.

questions.question: Computer generation that used vacuum tubes.
questions.explanation: First generation computers relied on vacuum tubes for processing.

questions.question: Component that replaced vacuum tubes in second generation computers.
questions.explanation: Transistors made computers smaller, faster, and more reliable.

questions.question: Person who developed the first compiler.
questions.explanation: Grace Hopper created the first compiler for programming languages.

questions.question: Inventor of the World Wide Web.
questions.explanation: Tim Berners-Lee invented the WWW in 1989.

questions.question: Co-founders of Apple Computer.
questions.explanation: Jobs and Wozniak founded Apple in 1976.

questions.question: Co-founders of Microsoft.
questions.explanation: Gates and Allen founded Microsoft in 1975.

questions.question: The first high-level programming language.
questions.explanation: Fortran was developed in the 1950s for scientific computing.

questions.question: The first widely used personal computer by IBM.
questions.explanation: The IBM PC was introduced in 1981 and became the industry standard.
